stories.title: Draghi Says Italy Will Eventually Make Vaccine Compulsory

stories.text:
I am currently evaluating different clouds and I am not sure if I should pay much attention to Azure given that we are not a typical .NET shop.

I have worked with .NET in the past and know that most ".NET shops" normally work on a very Microsofty vertical stack. SQL Server, Azure, Windows Servers, IIS, .NET, C#, Entity Framework, etc., however I haven't programmed in .NET for a very long time and I'm not sure if Azure is a good fit for a mostly Node, Python and Go team?

Does anyone have much experience with Azure from a complete non .NET perspective? I wonder what is the support for SDKs in other langages like. Are they any good? Do Azure services have good support for Node, Python and Go? For example in GCP I can debug Go code directly from the console and I wonder if Azure offers similar features or if they have most things tailored to .NET only?

I know that AWS works great with any language so I wanted to ask shall we just stick with AWS or is there a good case for switching to GCP or Azure?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do non .NET shops also use Azure?
